problems.title: Replace Negative Numbers with Zero
problems.description: Replace all negative numbers in the array with 0.
hintsList: Iterate through the array and check if element is less than 0.

problems.title: Replace Elements Divisible by 3 with -1
problems.description: Replace all elements divisible by 3 with -1.
hintsList: Use modulo operator (%) to check if element is divisible by 3.

problems.title: Replace First and Last Element with Zero
problems.description: Replace the first and last element of the array with 0.

problems.title: Replace Multiples of 5 with 5
problems.description: Write a Java program to replace all elements in the array that are multiples of 5 with the number 5 itself.
hintsList: Use modulo operator (%) to check if element is divisible by 5.

problems.title: Check if Array is Palindrome
problems.description: Check whether the given array is a palindrome. Print "true" if palindrome, otherwise print "false".
problems.examples:
Sample Input
5
1 2 3 2 1

Sample Output
true

Sample Input
4
1 2 3 4

Sample Output
false
hintsList: Use two pointers starting from both ends and compare elements.

problems.title: First Repeating Element
problems.description: Return the first element that repeats in the array. Use a boolean array or nested loops to track seen elements. Print "First repeating element is X" or "No repeating element" if none exists.
problems.examples:
Sample Input
7
10 5 3 4 3 5 6

Sample Output
First repeating element is 5
hintsList: Use a hash map to track first occurrence index. When you find an element that already exists, check if it's the earliest repeating element.

problems.title: Calculate Average of Array Elements
problems.description:
Calculate the average of all elements in an array. Print the average rounded to 2 decimal places.

Input Format:
First line contains n, the size of array.
Second line contains n space-separated integers.

Output Format:
Print the average rounded to 2 decimal places.
problems.examples:
Sample Input
5
10 20 30 40 50

Sample Output
30.00

Explanation:
Sum = 10 + 20 + 30 + 40 + 50 = 150
Average = 150 / 5 = 30.00
hintsList: First calculate the sum of all elements, then divide by array length.

problems.title: Print Elements Greater Than X
problems.description:
Print all elements in the array that are greater than a given number x. Print elements in the same order as they appear in the array, each on a new line. If no elements are greater than x, print nothing.

Input Format:
First line contains n, the size of array.
Second line contains n space-separated integers.
Third line contains x, the threshold value.

Output Format:
Print elements greater than x, each on a new line.
problems.examples:
Sample Input
5
10 20 30 40 50
25

Sample Output
30
40
50

Explanation:
Elements greater than 25 are 30, 40, and 50.
hintsList: Use if (arr[i] > x) inside the loop to check each element.

problems.title: Create Array of Squares
problems.description:
Create a new array where each element is the square of the corresponding element in the original array. Print the new array with space-separated values.

Input Format:
First line contains n, the size of array.
Second line contains n space-separated integers.

Output Format:
Print the new array with squares, space-separated.
problems.examples:
Sample Input
4
1 2 3 4

Sample Output
1 4 9 16

Explanation:
Squares: 1² = 1, 2² = 4, 3² = 9, 4² = 16
hintsList: Use newArr[i] = arr[i] * arr[i] in a loop.

problems.title: Print Pairs with Sum
problems.description:
Print all pairs of elements whose sum equals a target number. Each pair should be printed as "(i, j)" where i and j are the elements. Print pairs in the order they appear (i from first occurrence, j from later occurrence). Each pair on a new line.

Input Format:
First line contains n, the size of array.
Second line contains n space-separated integers.
Third line contains target, the target sum.

Output Format:
Print pairs in format "(i, j)" each on a new line. If no pairs found, print nothing.
problems.examples:
Sample Input
5
1 2 3 4 5
7

Sample Output
(2, 5)
(3, 4)

Explanation:
Pairs with sum 7: (2, 5) and (3, 4).
hintsList: Use nested loops and check if arr[i] + arr[j] == target.
